channel.title: Alerts Feed
channel.description: Alerts Feeds -- Los Angeles Fire Department

item.description: Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1433; 10:15PM; 524 E 33rd St; MAP: https://bit.ly/48Nd3eC; #HistoricSouthCentral; 44 LAFD Firefighters took just 17 minutes to access, confine and extinguish fire in the rear corner and attic of a 1,986 square foot one-story home (built 1906), preventing fire spread to an adjacent structure. Six civilians who were in our near the home at the time of the fire are being evaluated for non-specific complaints, including possible smoke exposure. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC13 E14 E15 E215 E221 E46 EM11 RA14 RA15 RA17 RA814 RA9 SO1 SQ21 T15 T21; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1433; 09:58PM; 524 E 33rd St; MAP: https://bit.ly/48Nd3eC; #HistoricSouthCentral; PRELIM: Heavy fire in the rear of a one-story home, with fire threatening an adjacent structure.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 9; BC1 BC13 E14 E15 E215 E221 E46 EM11 RA14 RA15 RA814 SQ21 T15 T21; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Helicopter Hoist Rescue; INC#0442; 09:42AM; Haines Canyon Mountainway; MAP: https://bit.ly/3wQ51o4; #Tujunga; LAFD ground and air response to the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains, for a 40 year-old male mountain bicyclist injured in a fall. A hovering LAFD Rescue Helicopter was able to find the patient, and lowered a Flight Paramedic to evaluate and medically stabilize the patient, who sustained a back injury. The patient and rescuer will soon be hoisted aboard the LAFD helicopter for continuing medical care during direct transport to a regional trauma center.; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 E24 E274 E290 H1 H4 H5 HA1 HA4 HA5 PB74 RA74 RA874 RH114 SO1 T74 T90; CH8; 17; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1594; 09:37PM; 14737 W Sherman Wy; MAP: https://bit.ly/4a5irL5; #VanNuys; 39 LAFD Firefighters took just 17 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish a contents fire in one room of a 2nd floor apartment in a 49,263 square foot, 82 unit, three-story O-shaped garden style apartment building (built 1969). No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 39; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC14 E239 E288 E290 E39 E81 E90 RA39 RA81 RA889 SO1 T39 T88 T90; CH9; 18; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1594; 09:20PM; 14737 W Sherman Wy; MAP: https://bit.ly/4a5irL5; #VanNuys; PRELIM: Three-story garden style apartment building with heavy smoke from one unit on the second floor.; FS 39; Batt 10; Valley Bureau; Council District 6; BC10 BC14 E239 E288 E290 E39 E81 E90 RA39 RA81 RA889 T39 T88 T90; CH9; 18; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Major Emergency Structure Fire 03/09/2024 INC#0367

item.description: Update Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0367; 05:00PM; 1400 E Newton St; MAP: https://bit.ly/4a5Xb7X; #Downtown; No witnesses have come forward to identify any specific persons as missing. The LAFD cadaver detection canine team's multi-hour search of the heavily damaged 9,100 square foot building yielded no indication of human remains. The five injured firefighters have been treated and released from medical care. No other civilian or firefighter injuries have been reported. No escalating or off-site hazards have been identified. The specific cause of the fire remains the focus of an LAFD investigation.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC12 BC13 BC18 BC5 BC731 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E14 E16 E2 E201 E202 E203 E209 E21 E210 E211 E215 E220 E221 E229 E248 E27 E295 E3 E450 E46 E48 E9 EA2 EM1 EM11 EM13 ER2 HE1 HR3 JT1 JT6 K902 K904 PH1 PI3 PI4 RA10 RA14 RA17 RA209 RA3 RA803 RA809 RA811 SO1 SQ21 SQ48 SQ95 T1 T10 T11 T15 T2 T20 T21 T29 T3 T48 T9 T95 UR3 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

Fatality Traffic Collision; INC#1024; 02:56PM; 5048 W Coliseum St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Twrcsl; #BaldwinHills #Crenshaw; PRELIM: Multi-vehicle traffic collision with a total of two patients (undetermined age / gender / affiliation / circumstances) who were initially trapped in the wreckage, and are both now deceased at scene. No other injuries are reported. Media Inquiries: LAPD South Traffic Division (Incident #2689) and Medical Examiner.; FS 94; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC1 BC11 E261 E294 E34 E61 E68 EM11 HR3 RA58 RA68 T61 T94; CH7; 13; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Major Emergency Structure Fire 03/09/2024 INC#0367

item.description: Update Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0367; 10:00AM; 1400 E Newton St; MAP: https://bit.ly/4a5Xb7X; #Downtown; As the formal investigation continues into the specific cause of the fire, it has been determined this was a non-permitted cannabis operation. A pair of cadaver detection canine teams will soon arrive to address unconfirmed reports that one or more persons *may* have been within the now heavily damaged building at the time of the fire. With *one additional* firefighter having experienced an unexpected burning sensation to their face early in the fire attack, there are now a total of *five* firefighters in fair condition, being medically evaluated at an area hospital. No other civilian or firefighter injuries have been reported. No escalating or off-site hazards have been identified.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; AR1 BC1 BC11 BC13 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E14 E2 E202 E203 E209 E21 E210 E211 E215 E220 E221 E248 E295 E3 E450 E46 E48 E9 EA2 EM1 EM11 EM13 HE1 HR3 JT1 K902 K904 PH1 PI3 PI4 RA10 RA14 RA17 RA209 RA3 RA803 RA809 RA811 SO1 SQ21 SQ48 SQ95 T10 T11 T15 T2 T20 T21 T3 T48 T9 T95 UR3 UR88; CH7; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Knockdown - Major Emergency Structure Fire 03/09/2024 INC#0367

item.description: Knockdown - Major Emergency Structure Fire; INC#0367; 08:56AM; 1400 E Newton St; MAP: https://bit.ly/4a5Xb7X; #Downtown; *Address Corrected* 145 LAFD Firefighters took just 56 minutes in largely defensive operations to access, confine and fully extinguish heavy fire within a 9,100 square foot two-story building in the Central Industrial District of downtown Los Angeles. The 69-year-old brick structure, heavily damaged by the intense fire, appears to have housed a cannabis operation (whether this was a legally permitted business, has yet to be determined). During their initial attack on the flames, four of the first arriving firefighters experienced an unexpected burning sensation to their faces. Pursuant to protocol, the four firefighters, in fair condition and without other medical complaints, have been taken to an area hospital for a comprehensive medical examination. No other injuries were reported, and no escalating or off-site hazards have been identified. With witness reports that one or more persons *may* have been within the structure when the fire erupted, a pair of cadaver detection canine teams have been requested. LAFD Public Information Officer Firefighter David Ortiz is at scene to assist the media. The cause of the fire remains under active investigation.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; E14 T9 E9 E209 RA209 RA809 E210 T10 SQ21 BC1 BC11 RA10 EM1 SO1 E221 T21 E10 E11 E203 T3 CM22 E215 T15 T95 E295 SQ95 EM11 BC13 E3 UR3 HR3 RA3 RA803 UR88 BC5 CM20 E21 BC18 T11 E211 E2 T2 E202 E46 AR1 RA811 EM13 T20 E220 E450 EA2 JT1 PH1 E48 T48 E248 SQ48 PI3 HE1 RA14 RA17 PI4 K902 K904; CH7; 12 13; Brian Humphrey

Greater Alarm Structure Fire; INC#0367; 08:00AM; 1405 E Newton St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3T87cec; #Downtown; PRELIM: Two story commercial building with fire through the roof.; FS 14; Batt 1; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC1 BC11 BC13 BC5 CM20 CM22 E10 E11 E14 E203 E209 E210 E215 E221 E295 E3 E9 EM1 EM11 HR3 RA10 RA209 RA3 RA803 RA809 SO1 SQ21 SQ95 T10 T15 T21 T3 T9 T95 UR3 UR88; CH9; 12, 13; Brian Humphrey
